block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Weekly, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.
Music and Dance

Bethel The Mike Leventhal Quartet, jazz. June 17 at 5 p.m. $10 minimum. Pizzeria Lauretano, 291 Greenwood Avenue. (203) 792-1500. Falls Village Music Mountain Summer Music Festival: Peter Serkin and the Bard Festival String Quartet, chamber music. June 17 at 1 p.m. $25 to $200. Music Mountain, 225 Music Mountain Road. (860) 824-7126. Greenwich Ghulam Ali, ghazal singer. June 10 at 5 p.m. $45. Cole Auditorium, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 322-9862. Litchfield ''Stomp, Strut and Swing into Summer Dance,'' featuring the Galvanized Jazz Band. June 16 at 7 p.m. $15; $25 per couple. Litchfield Community Center, 421 Bantam Road. (860) 567-8302. Mystic ''Sea Music Festival.'' Performances by the Northern Neck Chantey Singers, Fisher Poets and others. Through June 10. Free with museum admission; evening concerts require tickets. Mystic Seaport, 75 Germanville Avenue. (860) 572-0711. New Britain Craig Hart, bass; arias and musical theater classics. Friday at 7:30 p.m. South Church, 90 Main Street. (860) 223-7555. New Haven International Festival of Arts and Ideas: Angelique Kidjo, vocalist, with Gokh-Bi System, Senegalese hip-hop. June 10 at 7 p.m. Free. Tamango performs an urban tap global mix. June 16 at 8 p.m. Free. New Haven Green, (203) 776-7331. New Haven ''Giselle,'' performed by the State Ballet of Georgia. Friday through June 16 at 8 p.m. $48 to $10. Shubert Theater, 247 College Street. (203) 624-1825. Norwalk Norwalk Recreation and Parks Department's free summer concerts: Golden Ages of Jazz Band. June 17 at 3 p.m. Free with park entrance. Calf Pasture Beach, (203) 854-7900.
Spoken Word

Madison Dr. Caldwell B. Esselstyn Jr. discusses his book ''Prevent and Reverse Heart Disease.'' Monday at 7 p.m. Elizabeth Oberbeck reads from her book ''The Dressmaker.'' Tuesday at 7 p.m. ''Out of the Book,'' a multimedia event about Ian McEwan's new novel, ''On Chesil Beach.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. All free. R. J. Julia Booksellers, 768 Boston Road. (203) 245-3959. Stamford Jacqueline Winspear, author of the ''Maisie Dobbs'' mystery series. Monday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Ferguson Library, 115 Vine Road. (203) 964-1000.
Film

New Haven ''Awara Soup (Le bouillon d'awara),'' directed by César Paes; in French and other languages with English subtitles. Monday at 6:30 p.m. Free. New Haven Public Library, 133 Elm Street. (203) 946-8130. New Haven ''National Velvet,'' directed by Clarence Brown. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Yale Center for British Art, 1080 Chapel Street. (203) 432-2800. Stamford ''Nancy Drew,'' screening followed by a talk with the star, Emma Roberts. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Avon Theater, 272 Bedford Street. (203) 967-3660.
For Children

New Canaan ''Critters and Crafts.'' Learn facts and create crafts inspired by the red-eyed tree frog. June 16, 1:30 to 2:45 p.m. $11; members, $8. New Canaan Nature Center, 144 Oenoke Ridge. (203) 966-9577. West Hartford ''Color Play: The Art and Science of Color and Light.'' Explore light and holographic refraction. Ages 12 and under. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. The Children's Museum, 950 Trout Brook Drive. (860) 231-2824.
Theater

Glastonbury ''Nunsense!'' directed by Patrique Hurd. June 10 through 17. $18 and $20. Phoenix Theater Company at St. Paul's Hall, 40 Naubuc Avenue. (860) 291-2988. Hartford ''Nightingale,'' written and performed by Lynn Redgrave, directed by Joseph Hardy. Through July 1. $22 to $42. Hartford Stage, 50 Church Street. (860) 527-5151. Hartford Caryl Churchill's ''A Number,'' directed by Steve Campo. Friday through July 29. $35 and $45; student rush, $10. TheaterWorks Hartford, 233 Pearl Street. (860) 527-7838. Ledyard ''Alice Wonders '' A theater piece with music and dance, based on ''Alice in Wonderland.'' June 16 at 4 p.m. Free; donations welcomed. Dragon's Egg, 401 Shewville Road. (860) 535-3346. Milford ''I Hate Hamlet,'' comedy by Paul Rudnick, presented by Eastbound Theater, directed by Keith Padin. Through June 17. $12.50 and $15. Milford Center for the Arts, 40 Railroad Avenue. (203) 878-6647. Ridgefield ''Man of La Mancha,'' musical by Dale Wasserman, Joe Darion and Mitch Leigh; directed by Craig David Rosen. Friday through July 14. $20 and $24. Ridgefield Theater Barn, 37 Halpin Lane. (203) 431-9850. Torrington The Nancy Marine Studio Theater Season: ''A Streetcar Named Desire,'' drama by Tennessee Williams. Through June 17. $10.50 and $15.50. Warner Theater, 68 Main Street. (860) 489-7180. Waterbury ''Buddy: The Buddy Holly Story,'' with music from Ritchie Valens and the Big Bopper. Through June 10. $27 to $45. Seven Angels Theater, Plank Road in Hamilton Park Pavilion. (203) 757-4676. West Haven ''A Streetcar Named Desire,'' drama by Tennessee Williams, directed by Carol L. Penney. Through June 10. $6 and $12. Dodds Auditorium, University of New Haven, (203) 932-7246. Westport ''Souvenir,'' musical by Stephen Temperley, directed by Vivian Matalon. Through June 16. $35 and $55. Westport Country Playhouse, 25 Powers Court. (203) 227-4177. Westport ''Lend Me a Tenor'' by Ken Ludwig. Through June 17. $12 and $16. Westport Town Hall, 110 Myrtle Avenue. (203) 226-1983.
Museums and Galleries

Clinton ''In Full Bloom,'' an exhibition of flower-themed art. Through June 24. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Sylvan Gallery, 121 West Main Street. (860) 669-7278. Fairfield ''Emptiness,'' an exhibition of welded steel sculptures by Michael Rivera. June 17 through July 29. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Thomas J. Walsh Art Galley, 1073 North Benson Road. (203) 254-4000. Greenwich ''Abstraction: American and European Art in the Twentieth Century,'' works by Fernand Léger, George Valmier and others. Through June 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Abby M. Taylor Fine Art, 43 Greenwich Avenue. (203) 622-0906. Greenwich ''Weaving a Collection: Native American Baskets From the Bruce Museum.'' Through June 10. ''Zip, Bop and Whir: Toys of the 20th Century,'' exhibition exploring the evolution of toy technology. Through July 8. ''Fakes and Forgeries: The Art of Deception,'' over 50 examples of forged Western painting and sculpture. Through Sept. 9. $6 and $7; children 5 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bruce Museum of Arts and Sciences, 1 Museum Drive. (203) 869-0376. Greenwich The Art Students League, works by students. Free. Through June 24. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900.
